snippet: Army investigators said soldiers, civilians and National Guard recruiters used the program as a “bounty” from which they could illegally collect money.
abstract: Military investigators say Army program meant to increase number of recruits during Iraq and Afghanistan wars devolved into illegal free-for-all that could cost taxpayers close to $100 million; describe huge criminal endeavor implicating more than 1,200, 200 of them officers, in which National Guard recruiters used program as a 'bounty' from which they illegally collected money for recruiting soldiers they did not recruit.
lead_paragraph: Army investigators said soldiers, civilians and National Guard recruiters used the program as a “bounty” from which they could illegally collect money.

headline.main: Fraud in Army Recruiting Bonus Program May Cost Nearly $100 Million
